conclusion: The question asks how the shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves backwards.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks the light.
The size and shape of the shadow depend on the size of the object, the distance between the object and the light source, and the distance between the object and the surface on which the shadow falls.

premise: When the light source moves backwards, it increases the distance between the light source and the objects.
conclusion: The shadow becomes smaller because the angle of the light rays hitting the object becomes more acute.
